skill.name: docs-review
skill.description: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewing pull requests, files, or diffs containing documentation markdown files.
skill.summary: Review documentation changes for compliance with the Metabase writing style guide. Use when reviewin...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation review skill with no executable code. The allowed tools (Read, Grep, Bash, Glob) are appropriate for reviewing markdown files. Behavior matches stated purpose of style guide compliance checking.

content.value_statement: Documentation pull requests often miss style guide violations. This skill automatically checks markdown changes against Metabase writing standards and reports issues with numbered feedback for easy reference.
actual_capabilities: Check documentation for formal or corporate language
Verify link text follows style conventions
Output numbered feedback for easy tracking
Integrate with GitHub PR review workflow
limitations: Only validates against Metabase-specific style guide
Cannot execute code to verify examples work
Does not check for factual accuracy

use_cases.title: Automated style checking
use_cases.description: Catch style violations automatically before merging documentation changes to the codebase.

use_cases.title: PR documentation review
use_cases.description: Use the GitHub integration to post style feedback directly on pull request comments.

use_cases.title: Pre-submission validation
use_cases.description: Ensure your documentation edits meet standards before creating a pull request.

prompt_templates.title: Basic review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to review this markdown file for style guide compliance.

prompt_templates.title: PR review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review changes in a GitHub PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the documentation changes in this pull request using the docs-review skill.

prompt_templates.title: Focused checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to check for corporate language, vague headings, and links in headings.

prompt_templates.title: Full compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full documentation review against the Metabase style guide. Check tone, structure, links, formatting, and code examples.

output_examples.input: Review this documentation file for style compliance
output: Issue 1: Formal tone - Line 12: Consider using 'you can't' instead of 'you cannot' for a conversational tone.
Issue 2: Vague heading - Line 8: Heading could state the point directly. Try 'Set up your database' instead of 'Configuration process'.
Issue 3: Link text - Line 25: Avoid linking the word 'here'. Use descriptive text like 'Read the installation guide'.

best_practices: Run the review after writing or editing documentation, before submitting PRs
Address issues in order since they are numbered for easy reference
Use the GitHub integration to post comments directly on pull requests
anti_patterns: Submitting documentation without running a style check
Ignoring issues that seem minor but compound to reduce readability
Using the skill for non-documentation files like code or config

faq.question: What documentation formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with markdown files (.md) containing documentation changes.

faq.question: Does this check for broken links?
faq.answer: No, the skill checks link text conventions but cannot verify if URLs are valid.

faq.question: Can I use this with GitHub Enterprise?
faq.answer: Yes, if the GitHub MCP tool is configured and available in your environment.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill runs locally using Read and Grep tools. GitHub comments post directly to the PR.

faq.question: Why are issues numbered?
faq.answer: Numbering allows you to reference specific issues when making fixes, like 'fix issues 2 and 5'.

faq.question: How is this different from markdown linters?
faq.answer: This checks Metabase-specific writing style including tone, voice, and clarity - not just syntax.
